#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Crowdfund a Concert
#Text=This article explains how a musician , a band or their teams can launch and run a crowdfunding campaign for a concert , show or a gig .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Plan your program .
#Text=Decide on your tracklist , host , supporting acts , any additional entertainment , like quests or contests .
#Text=Calculate your budget .
#Text=Consider what costs an event you are planning is going to include :
#Text=venue
#Text=artist and host fees
#Text=equipment rentals
#Text=staffing the event
#Text=transportation and accommodation costs
#Text=stage decor
#Text=Select the crowdfunding platform .
#Text=You can go with a general-purpose crowdfunding platform ( Kickstarter , Indiegogo ) or a concert-specific platform ( Show4me ) .
#Text=Produce promotional materials .
#Text=Prepare an exciting , engaging description of your event , promotional images , posters , flyers , images for social media .
#Text=A promo video can be a great way to make your campaign much more enticing for potential concertgoers , as well as existing fans .
#Text=Fill out the campaign page and launch .
#Text=Enter all the information about your campaign : the title of your show , prospective date and venue ( subject to change ) , description , upload video and photos .
#Text=On concert-specific platforms for crowdfunding you can list event sponsors or any age restrictions .
#Text=Set ticket types and prices and launch your campaign .
#Text=Promote your campaign .

#Text=Announce your launch on all your best social media , let your fans and friends know , put up posters close to your prospective location and/or handout flyers , run ads if you have the budget to .
#Text=Set your date and distribute tickets .
#Text=Once your minimum funding budget is met , you can contact and book the venue and set your performance date .
#Text=If you are using a general-purpose crowdfunding platform , you 'll have to take care of ticket design , production and distribution .
#Text=If you are using a concert-specific crowdfunding platform , the tickets will be generated and delivered to attendees ' inboxes automatically .
#Text=Withdraw funds to finance your production .
#Text=Hold your event .
#Text=Complete the preparations for your show and host the event !
#Text=Thank contributors .
#Text=With all the effort you 've put into promoting your show and getting all the contributions , you would n't want that to go to waste .

#Text=Keep your supporters engaged with your music , art and career by running a fan hub on a social media platform or continue interacting with your backers on the crowdfunding platform , as some offer the social network-like features , making it easier to crowdfund your next event .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Make sure your campaign description is exciting and you know exactly the audience you want to attend your event .
#Text=The more your description appeals to your target audience , the better are your chances of getting the campaign fully funded .
#Text=If you want your tickets to be sent out to your backers automatically , go with a concert-specific crowdfunding platform .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=The success of your campaign is contingent on your promotional efforts .
#Text=The bigger the budget , the more promotional effort your campaign will require .
